ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A good introduction to the structure of the Navy - I feel I have a better understanding of the branch.
knowledge and skills that will be useful in the future
Introductory, valuable skills on how to become a Naval officer.
We were instructed in the basic knowledge necessary for a midshipman to be successful on their first summer cruise. the course really is basic information that any naval officer needs to know.
This class was a good first step at becoming a naval officer. It was very broad in its scope, but it was an important basis to have going forward in my NROTC and naval career.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It taught what it was supposed to teach well, but its material lends itself to being dry and uninteresting.

The course is typically lecture-based, with meager class participation, excluding maybe a few students answering questions. Depending on the student, this may be considered a weakness. This could be improved through additional seminar-based lessons on various topics. There are quizzes on assigned reading almost every day, which may be a strength because all students are required to come prepared to class.

A lot of content is covered in the class but at the same time it was not difficult to understand what we were being taught. However, I did wish that there was a bit more classroom discussion throughout the semester like there was a the end of the semester. While some of the topics are not conducive to discussion, some are and there was little to no discussion on those topics. As an intro course, I was interested to see more input about why midshipmen decided to join NROTC and more constructive discussion about the different warfare communities.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Only take this if you are genuinely interested in the inner workings of the Navy.
I would recommend this course only to midshipman in Yale NROTC or PLC candidates for the Marine Corps, as the information is quite specific to future naval officers.
I strongly recommend this class and NROTC to anyone who is interested in being a part of the greatest team on the planet.
